articles.description: New Zealand end Ireland's World Cup dream and set up a semi-final against Argentina with a 28-24 win at Stade de France.
articles.title: All Blacks beat Ireland to set up Pumas semi-final

articles.description: Warren Gatland wants to remain as Wales head coach despite watching his side get knocked out of the World Cup.
articles.title: Gatland vows to rebuild Wales after World Cup exit

articles.description: Wigan winger Liam Marshall hopes their Super League Grand Final win against Catalans can spur them to more silverware.
articles.title: Marshall hopes Grand Final win starts Wigan dynasty

articles.description: Qatari banker Sheikh Jassim bin Hamad Al Thani withdraws from the process to buy Manchester United.
articles.title: Qatar's Sheikh Jassim withdraws from bid to buy Man Utd

articles.description: Watch highlights as hosts India cruise to a seven-wicket victory against Pakistan with almost 20 overs to spare at the World Cup.
articles.title: India thrash Pakistan at World Cup - highlights

articles.description: India's victory over arch-rivals Pakistan, with a huge, partisan crowd watching on, was a World Cup match like no other.
articles.title: 'India show their strength on day like no other'

articles.description: Sam Kerr scores her first goal of the season as reigning Women's Super League champions Chelsea beat West Ham to move top of the table.
articles.title: Kerr scores first of season as Chelsea go top

articles.description: Tommy Fury beats fellow social media star KSI on points in their unlicensed boxing fight in front of a capacity 20,000 crowd at Manchester's AO Arena.
articles.title: Fury outpoints KSI in unlicensed grudge match

articles.description: Watch the key moments as Argentina beat Wales and New Zealand overcome Ireland in dramatic quarter-finals to knock them out of the Rugby World Cup
articles.title: Ireland and Wales exit World Cup after quarter-final defeats

articles.description: Northern Ireland forward Paul Smyth says he "couldn't have asked for a better day" after scoring the opener as they defeated San Marino 3-0 at Windsor Park on Saturday.
articles.title: 'I couldn't have asked for a better day' - Smyth on NI win
